intro: Endymion non-scriptus, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers and glossy, silver-green foliage. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
